meaningMnemonic: A <radical>coat rack</radical> will turn into a <radical>bundle</radical> of sticks if you <kanji>neglect</kanji> it. When you neglect a coat rack, the weight from the coats will pull all of the arms off, leaving it as a <kanji>sparse</kanji> stick.
readingMnemonic: You go up to the <kanji>neglect</kanji>ed coat rack and try to make things right by cleaning it with <reading>so</reading>ap (そ). But no matter how much you scrub, it won't get clean, the arms won't go back on.
